Class AffineTransformation<N extends Number>

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearCombination<N>
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.AffineTransformation<N>
All Implemented Interfaces:
NumberTypeAgnostic<N>, EstimationFunction<N>, ScalarEstimationFunction<N>, TrainableScalarFunction<N>, TrainableFunction<N>
Direct Known Subclasses:
LinearBasisFunctionModel
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public class AffineTransformation<N extends Number> extends LinearCombination<N>
A simple linear scalar model of the form: 
   f(x) = bias + Σ w_i * x_i
where the bias and weights are trainable parameters.

This class supports forward estimation of the scalar output as well as calculation of parameter parameterGradients required for gradient-based training.

  • Constructor Details

    • AffineTransformation

      public AffineTransformation(Array<N> parameters, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport)
      Constructs a AffineTransformation with the given parameter vector.

      The first element of the array is treated as the bias, while the subsequent elements are the weights.

      Parameters:
      parameters - the parameters

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static <N extends Number> AffineTransformation<N> create(int dimensions, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport)
      Creates a new AffineTransformation with the specified number of input dimensions.

      The underlying parameter vector will have length dimensions + 1, with the first element reserved for the bias and the rest for the weights.

      Parameters:
      dimensions - number of input features
      Returns:
      a new AffineTransformation instance with zero-initialized parameters

    • estimateScalar

      public N estimateScalar(Array<N> inputs)
      Estimates the scalar output of this affine transformation for the given input vector.

      The computation is: 

         output = bias + Σ (inputs[i] * weights[i])
      Specified by:
      estimateScalar in interface ScalarEstimationFunction<N extends Number>
      Overrides:
      estimateScalar in class LinearCombination<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the scalar output value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs.length != arity()

    • calculateParameterGradients

      public Array<N> calculateParameterGradients(Array<N> inputs)
      Calculates the parameterGradients of the output with respect to all parameters (bias and weights) for the given input vector.

      The gradient vector has length 1 + arity(), where:

      • Index 0 corresponds to the derivative w.r.t. the bias (always 1).
      • Indices 1..arity correspond to the input values, i.e. ∂f/∂w_i = input[i-1].
      Specified by:
      calculateParameterGradients in interface TrainableScalarFunction<N extends Number>
      Overrides:
      calculateParameterGradients in class LinearCombination<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the gradient vector (bias gradient followed by weight parameterGradients)

    • getParameters

      public Array<N> getParameters()

    • adjustParameters

      public void adjustParameters(Array<N> deltas)
      Adjusts all parameters (except the first one, typically the bias) by adding the corresponding deltas.
      Parameters:
      deltas - an array of additive updates, aligned with the parameter vector

      Parameters:

      delta - the increment to add to the parameter value
